document_data.name: Englezaer
document_data.gender: MaleThe title of 'enchanter' is gendered, given the use of 'enchantress'. Thus, this article is written under the assumption Englezaer was male-gendered.
document_data.daterefs: {{cite web/Candlekeep Forum/Questions for Ed Greenwood (2009)/06-28 - Fools as Her Champions}}The date in the book is wrong due to editing error; see web cite
document_data.mainbody: '''Englezaer''', also known as Englezaer the Enchanter, was a mage who challenged [[the Simbul]] prior to {{yearlink|1262}}. She won, and Englezaer perished.
document_data.Legends & Rumors: In {{yearlink|1262}}, [[Elminster Aumar]] judged that [[the Simbul]]'s slaying of mages, whether from [[Thay]] or not, had become excessive, and the feats of her power were tilting the balance of power around [[Aglarond]]. Amongst other mages slain, he counted Englezaer the Enchanter.
